title: Government of Maharashtra to organize Maharashtra International Travel Mart
text: Government of Maharashtra to organize Maharashtra International Travel Mart By Divya Sathyanarayanan , ET Bureau | 16 Sep, 2015, 05.28PM IST ET SPECIAL: Love visual aspect of news? Enjoy this exclusive slideshows treat! MUMBAI: For the first time, government of Maharashtra will organize a three-day tourism event called Maharashtra International Travel Mart (MITM) from September 28th to 30th, 2015. MITM will witness participation of 250 registered buyers, hoteliers and travel agents from India and overseas. The event will highlight the lesser known and prominent tourist attractions in Maharashtra like cultural festivals, beaches, UNESCO World Heritage Sites, konkan region, pilgrimage destinations, wildlife and national parks, social and study tourism among others. "Objective of the tourism mart is to place Maharashtra as an year-round destination for tourists and to showcase the cultural assets and traditions," said Valsa Nair Singh, secretary tourism, government of Maharashtra, adding that MITM will provide impetus to the inbound travel and tourism industry in the state. Singh said Amitabh Bachchan , Maharashtra's tiger ambassador , is also expected to be a part of the event. The event will also host seminars on topics such as film tourism, promoting Mumbai as a standalone destination, peace tourism, medical/wellness tourism and women empowerment through tourism. "MITM is a build up to the 'Visit Maharashtra' year which be declared in 2017," said Singh. Tour companies from the US, the UK, South Africa, France, Greece, Japan and Australia among others are expected to participate in MITM. Singh said the government expects a footfall of around 3,000 during the three-day event. Currently, the state is witnessing 7-8% year on year growth in tourists. "The idea is to take this growth to 10%, with these kind of events," said Paraag Jaiin Nainuttia , MD - Maharashtra Tourism Development Corporation (MTDC). During the event, the government is also planning to launch a mobile app for tourists coming to the state. Stay on top of business news with The Economic Times App. Download it Now!
